summary: Kamala Harris' campaign team is reportedly vetting retired Admiral William McRaven, who oversaw the May 2011 Navy SEAL raid that killed Osama bin Laden, as a potential 2024 running mate for Vice President Kamala Harris. Other potential candidates include Arizona Senator Mark Kelly, Pennsylvania Governor Josh Shapiro, and Kentucky Governor Andy Beshear. McRaven was commander of the U.S. Joint Special Operations Command between 2008 and 2011, and served as head of the United States Special Ops Command from August 2011 to 2014. He also served as Chancellor of the University of Texas System for over three years. As of Thursday morning, bookmaker William Hill had Senator Kelly as the firm favorite to be the Democrat's 2024 vice-presidential candidate with odds of 42.1 percent and 28.6 percent.

summary: Vice President Kamala Harris' list of potential running mates has narrowed to include one U.S. senator and several prominent Democratic governors. The Wall Street Journal reported that potential vice presidential candidates had been asked to provide vetting materials to the Harris campaign. This comes after President Joe Biden ended the presidential race and endorsed Harris. The Harris campaign has reportedly sought vetting materials from Senator Mark Kelly of Arizona, Governor Roy Cooper of North Carolina, Governor Josh Shapiro of Pennsylvania, Governor Gretchen Whitmer of Michigan, Governor J.B. Pritzker of Illinois, and Governor Tim Walz of Minnesota. However, Governor Andy Beshear of Kentucky has reportedly not been asked for vetting materials.

summary: Kamala Harris is currently vetting three potential candidates for the upcoming presidential election, including Mark Kelly, Josh SHAPIRO, and Tim Walz, the governor of Minnesota. These are seen as key decisions for Harris, as she knows her role as vice president is if something happens to the president. The campaign rollout of Kamala Harris has seen a surge in support for her, with her poll numbers up and her ability to play better in swing states than her predecessor, Joe Biden. She also brings a different coalition than Biden, with younger voters and voters of color who may have previously shunned from the Biden campaign. Despite this, there are concerns that this could change the course of action for Harris.

summary: Vice President Kamala Harris has defended President Joe Biden against pressure to drop out of the presidential race following a poor debate performance. If Biden withdraws, some Democrats believe Harris would be the logical choice to replace him on the top of the Democratic ticket. Harris, who is the first woman, Black person, and person of South Asian descent to serve as vice president, could face a difficult task of choosing a running mate who would give her the best chance of beating Donald Trump and becoming the nation's first woman president. Other potential running mates include California Gov. Gavin Newsom, Michigan's Whitmer, and Illinois's Shapiro. However, Newsom's lack of addressing issues such as homelessness could cause problems. JPMorgan Chase CEO Jamie Dim could help win over Republican voters who don't want a second term.

summary: Pennsylvania Gov. Josh Shapiro is being considered as potential running mates for Vice President Kamala Harris after President Joe Biden dropped out of the race. Shapiro, a first-term Democratic governor, is a polished communicator and has been praised by both his own party and some Republicans. Other potential VP picks include North Carolina Gov. Roy Cooper, Kentucky Gov. Andy Beshear, and Michigan Gov. Gretchen Whitmer. This would be the first all-women ticket in history.

summary: Former White House press secretary, Sean Spicer, has speculated that Kamala Harris will either pick Arizona Senator Mark Kelly or Pennsylvania Governor Josh Shapiro as her running mate. Joe Biden has ended his re-election campaign and endorsed KamalaHarris as the Democratic candidate. Spicer suggested that Harris may choose Kelly or Shapiro as running mate, and Shapiro as possible.

summary: The Kamala Harris campaign has provided a potential clue about who would be her running mate if she secures the Democratic Party's presidential nomination. If she becomes the Vice President, she will need to pick a running mate. Kentucky Governor Andy Beshear is believed to be one of the potential options. The campaign posted three clips from Besheer's interview with MSNBC News, including a comment about JD Vance's controversial memoir Hillbilly Elegy, which has been criticized for stereotyping the Appalachia region. Vance has responded by criticising the author for calling the hardworking coal miners that powered the Industrial Revolution and two world wars. Other Democrats rumored to be on Harris' shortlist include Pennsylvania Governor Josh Shapiro, North Carolina Governor Roy Cooper and Arizona Senator Mark Kelly.

summary: Vice President Kamala Harris is expected to reveal her running mate for her 2024 presidential bid within a week. Michigan Gov. Gretchen Whitmer, rumored to be a potential choice for the Democratic ticket, said she has not been part of the vetting process but expects the announcement soon. Other potential candidates include North Carolina Gov. Roy Cooper, Pennsylvania Gov. Josh Shapiro, U.S. Sen. Mark Kelly, Minnesota Gov. Tim Walz, Illinois Gov. J.B. Pritzker and Transportation Secretary Pete Buttigieg. The Harris campaign dismissed the rumors as premature and speculative.

summary: Vice President Kamala Harris is reportedly planning to announce her running mate before a tour of battleground states next week. This comes as she approaches securing the Democratic presidential nomination. Harris became the party's leading candidate after stepping in for President Joe Biden. There is speculation that Harris is considering several candidates, including Kentucky Governor Andy Beshear, Pennsylvania Governor Josh Shapiro, U.S. Senator Mark Kelly of Arizona, Minnesota Governor Tim Walz, and Secretary of Transportation Pete Buttigieg. The decision may be announced sooner than expected.

summary: The Kamala Harris campaign has provided a potential clue about who would be her running mate if she secures the Democratic Party's presidential nomination. If she becomes the Vice President, she will need to pick a running mate. Kentucky Governor Andy Beshear is believed to be one of the potential options. The campaign posted three clips from Besheer's interview with MSNBC News, including a comment about JD Vance's controversial memoir Hillbilly Elegy, which has been criticized for stereotyping the Appalachia region. Vance has responded by criticising the author for calling the hardworking coal miners that powered the Industrial Revolution and two world wars. Other Democrats rumored to be on Harris' shortlist include Pennsylvania Governor Josh Shapiro, North Carolina Governor Roy Cooper and Arizona Senator Mark Kelly.
cleaned_summaries: kamala harris campaign provided potential clue would running mate secures democratic party presidential nomination becomes vice president need pick running mate kentucky governor andy beshear believed one potential option campaign posted three clip besheers interview msnbc news including comment jd vances controversial memoir hillbilly elegy criticized stereotyping appalachia region vance responded criticising author calling hardworking coal miner powered industrial revolution two world war democrat rumored harris shortlist include pennsylvania governor josh shapiro north carolina governor roy cooper arizona senator mark kelly

summary: Vice President Kamala Harris is expected to reveal her running mate for her 2024 presidential bid within a week. Michigan Gov. Gretchen Whitmer, rumored to be a potential choice for the Democratic ticket, said she has not been part of the vetting process but expects the announcement soon. Other potential candidates include North Carolina Gov. Roy Cooper, Pennsylvania Gov. Josh Shapiro, U.S. Sen. Mark Kelly, Minnesota Gov. Tim Walz, Illinois Gov. J.B. Pritzker and Transportation Secretary Pete Buttigieg. The Harris campaign dismissed the rumors as premature and speculative.
cleaned_summaries: vice president kamala harris expected reveal running mate 2024 presidential bid within week michigan gov gretchen whitmer rumored potential choice democratic ticket said part vetting process expects announcement soon potential candidate include north carolina gov roy cooper pennsylvania gov josh shapiro u sen mark kelly minnesota gov tim walz illinois gov jb pritzker transportation secretary pete buttigieg harris campaign dismissed rumor premature speculative

summary: Vice President Kamala Harris is reportedly planning to announce her running mate before a tour of battleground states next week. This comes as she approaches securing the Democratic presidential nomination. Harris became the party's leading candidate after stepping in for President Joe Biden. There is speculation that Harris is considering several candidates, including Kentucky Governor Andy Beshear, Pennsylvania Governor Josh Shapiro, U.S. Senator Mark Kelly of Arizona, Minnesota Governor Tim Walz, and Secretary of Transportation Pete Buttigieg. The decision may be announced sooner than expected.
cleaned_summaries: vice president kamala harris reportedly planning announce running mate tour battleground state next week come approach securing democratic presidential nomination harris became party leading candidate stepping president joe biden speculation harris considering several candidate including kentucky governor andy beshear pennsylvania governor josh shapiro u senator mark kelly arizona minnesota governor tim walz secretary transportation pete buttigieg decision may announced sooner expected

summary: Kamala Harris' campaign team is reportedly vetting retired Admiral William McRaven, who oversaw the May 2011 Navy SEAL raid that killed Osama bin Laden, as a potential 2024 running mate for Vice President Kamala Harris. Other potential candidates include Arizona Senator Mark Kelly, Pennsylvania Governor Josh Shapiro, and Kentucky Governor Andy Beshear. McRaven was commander of the U.S. Joint Special Operations Command between 2008 and 2011, and served as head of the United States Special Ops Command from August 2011 to 2014. He also served as Chancellor of the University of Texas System for over three years. As of Thursday morning, bookmaker William Hill had Senator Kelly as the firm favorite to be the Democrat's 2024 vice-presidential candidate with odds of 42.1 percent and 28.6 percent.

summary: Vice President Kamala Harris' list of potential running mates has narrowed to include one U.S. senator and several prominent Democratic governors. The Wall Street Journal reported that potential vice presidential candidates had been asked to provide vetting materials to the Harris campaign. This comes after President Joe Biden ended the presidential race and endorsed Harris. The Harris campaign has reportedly sought vetting materials from Senator Mark Kelly of Arizona, Governor Roy Cooper of North Carolina, Governor Josh Shapiro of Pennsylvania, Governor Gretchen Whitmer of Michigan, Governor J.B. Pritzker of Illinois, and Governor Tim Walz of Minnesota. However, Governor Andy Beshear of Kentucky has reportedly not been asked for vetting materials.

summary: Kamala Harris is currently vetting three potential candidates for the upcoming presidential election, including Mark Kelly, Josh SHAPIRO, and Tim Walz, the governor of Minnesota. These are seen as key decisions for Harris, as she knows her role as vice president is if something happens to the president. The campaign rollout of Kamala Harris has seen a surge in support for her, with her poll numbers up and her ability to play better in swing states than her predecessor, Joe Biden. She also brings a different coalition than Biden, with younger voters and voters of color who may have previously shunned from the Biden campaign. Despite this, there are concerns that this could change the course of action for Harris.

summary: Vice President Kamala Harris has defended President Joe Biden against pressure to drop out of the presidential race following a poor debate performance. If Biden withdraws, some Democrats believe Harris would be the logical choice to replace him on the top of the Democratic ticket. Harris, who is the first woman, Black person, and person of South Asian descent to serve as vice president, could face a difficult task of choosing a running mate who would give her the best chance of beating Donald Trump and becoming the nation's first woman president. Other potential running mates include California Gov. Gavin Newsom, Michigan's Whitmer, and Illinois's Shapiro. However, Newsom's lack of addressing issues such as homelessness could cause problems. JPMorgan Chase CEO Jamie Dim could help win over Republican voters who don't want a second term.

Shapiro, a first-term Democratic governor, is a polished communicator and has been praised by both his own party and some Republicans. Other potential VP picks include North Carolina Gov. Roy Cooper, Kentucky Gov. Andy Beshear, and Michigan Gov. Gretchen Whitmer. This would be the first all-women ticket in history.

Other potential candidates include North Carolina Gov. Roy Cooper, Pennsylvania Gov. Josh Shapiro, U.S. Sen. Mark Kelly, Minnesota Gov. Tim Walz, Illinois Gov. J.B. Pritzker and Transportation Secretary Pete Buttigieg. The Harris campaign dismissed the rumors as premature and speculative.

summary: Vice President Kamala Harris is reportedly planning to announce her running mate before a tour of battleground states next week. This comes as she approaches securing the Democratic presidential nomination. Harris became the party's leading candidate after stepping in for President Joe Biden. There is speculation that Harris is considering several candidates, including Kentucky Governor Andy Beshear, Pennsylvania Governor Josh Shapiro, U.S. Senator Mark Kelly of Arizona, Minnesota Governor Tim Walz, and Secretary of Transportation Pete Buttigieg. The decision may be announced sooner than expected.
cleaned_summaries: vice president kamala harris reportedly planning announce running mate tour battleground state next week come approach securing democratic presidential nomination harris became party leading candidate stepping president joe biden speculation harris considering several candidate including kentucky governor andy beshear pennsylvania governor josh shapiro u senator mark kelly arizona minnesota governor tim walz secretary transportation pete buttigieg decision may announced sooner expected

summary: Kamala Harris' campaign team is reportedly vetting retired Admiral William McRaven, who oversaw the May 2011 Navy SEAL raid that killed Osama bin Laden, as a potential 2024 running mate for Vice President Kamala Harris. Other potential candidates include Arizona Senator Mark Kelly, Pennsylvania Governor Josh Shapiro, and Kentucky Governor Andy Beshear. McRaven was commander of the U.S. Joint Special Operations Command between 2008 and 2011, and served as head of the United States Special Ops Command from August 2011 to 2014. He also served as Chancellor of the University of Texas System for over three years. As of Thursday morning, bookmaker William Hill had Senator Kelly as the firm favorite to be the Democrat's 2024 vice-presidential candidate with odds of 42.1 percent and 28.6 percent.

summary: Vice President Kamala Harris' list of potential running mates has narrowed to include one U.S. senator and several prominent Democratic governors. The Wall Street Journal reported that potential vice presidential candidates had been asked to provide vetting materials to the Harris campaign. This comes after President Joe Biden ended the presidential race and endorsed Harris. The Harris campaign has reportedly sought vetting materials from Senator Mark Kelly of Arizona, Governor Roy Cooper of North Carolina, Governor Josh Shapiro of Pennsylvania, Governor Gretchen Whitmer of Michigan, Governor J.B. Pritzker of Illinois, and Governor Tim Walz of Minnesota. However, Governor Andy Beshear of Kentucky has reportedly not been asked for vetting materials.

summary: Kamala Harris is currently vetting three potential candidates for the upcoming presidential election, including Mark Kelly, Josh SHAPIRO, and Tim Walz, the governor of Minnesota. These are seen as key decisions for Harris, as she knows her role as vice president is if something happens to the president. The campaign rollout of Kamala Harris has seen a surge in support for her, with her poll numbers up and her ability to play better in swing states than her predecessor, Joe Biden. She also brings a different coalition than Biden, with younger voters and voters of color who may have previously shunned from the Biden campaign. Despite this, there are concerns that this could change the course of action for Harris.

summary: Vice President Kamala Harris has defended President Joe Biden against pressure to drop out of the presidential race following a poor debate performance. If Biden withdraws, some Democrats believe Harris would be the logical choice to replace him on the top of the Democratic ticket. Harris, who is the first woman, Black person, and person of South Asian descent to serve as vice president, could face a difficult task of choosing a running mate who would give her the best chance of beating Donald Trump and becoming the nation's first woman president. Other potential running mates include California Gov. Gavin Newsom, Michigan's Whitmer, and Illinois's Shapiro. However, Newsom's lack of addressing issues such as homelessness could cause problems. JPMorgan Chase CEO Jamie Dim could help win over Republican voters who don't want a second term.

Roy Cooper, Kentucky Gov. Andy Beshear, and Michigan Gov. Gretchen Whitmer. This would be the first all-women ticket in history.

summary: The Kamala Harris campaign has provided a potential clue about who would be her running mate if she secures the Democratic Party's presidential nomination. If she becomes the Vice President, she will need to pick a running mate. Kentucky Governor Andy Beshear is believed to be one of the potential options. The campaign posted three clips from Besheer's interview with MSNBC News, including a comment about JD Vance's controversial memoir Hillbilly Elegy, which has been criticized for stereotyping the Appalachia region. Vance has responded by criticising the author for calling the hardworking coal miners that powered the Industrial Revolution and two world wars. Other Democrats rumored to be on Harris' shortlist include Pennsylvania Governor Josh Shapiro, North Carolina Governor Roy Cooper and Arizona Senator Mark Kelly.

JPMorgan Chase CEO Jamie Dim could help win over Republican voters who don't want a second term.

The campaign posted three clips from Besheer's interview with MSNBC News, including a comment about JD Vance's controversial memoir Hillbilly Elegy, which has been criticized for stereotyping the Appalachia region. Vance has responded by criticising the author for calling the hardworking coal miners that powered the Industrial Revolution and two world wars. Other Democrats rumored to be on Harris' shortlist include Pennsylvania Governor Josh Shapiro, North Carolina Governor Roy Cooper and Arizona Senator Mark Kelly.
cleaned_summaries: kamala harris campaign provided potential clue would running mate secures democratic party presidential nomination becomes vice president need pick running mate kentucky governor andy beshear believed one potential option campaign posted three clip besheers interview msnbc news including comment jd vances controversial memoir hillbilly elegy criticized stereotyping appalachia region vance responded criticising author calling hardworking coal miner powered industrial revolution two world war democrat rumored harris shortlist include pennsylvania governor josh shapiro north carolina governor roy cooper arizona senator mark kelly

summary: Vice President Kamala Harris is expected to reveal her running mate for her 2024 presidential bid within a week. Michigan Gov. Gretchen Whitmer, rumored to be a potential choice for the Democratic ticket, said she has not been part of the vetting process but expects the announcement soon. Other potential candidates include North Carolina Gov. Roy Cooper, Pennsylvania Gov. Josh Shapiro, U.S. Sen. Mark Kelly, Minnesota Gov. Tim Walz, Illinois Gov. J.B. Pritzker and Transportation Secretary Pete Buttigieg. The Harris campaign dismissed the rumors as premature and speculative.

summary: Vice President Kamala Harris is reportedly planning to announce her running mate before a tour of battleground states next week. This comes as she approaches securing the Democratic presidential nomination. Harris became the party's leading candidate after stepping in for President Joe Biden. There is speculation that Harris is considering several candidates, including Kentucky Governor Andy Beshear, Pennsylvania Governor Josh Shapiro, U.S. Senator Mark Kelly of Arizona, Minnesota Governor Tim Walz, and Secretary of Transportation Pete Buttigieg. The decision may be announced sooner than expected.

summary: Kamala Harris' campaign team is reportedly vetting retired Admiral William McRaven, who oversaw the May 2011 Navy SEAL raid that killed Osama bin Laden, as a potential 2024 running mate for Vice President Kamala Harris. Other potential candidates include Arizona Senator Mark Kelly, Pennsylvania Governor Josh Shapiro, and Kentucky Governor Andy Beshear. McRaven was commander of the U.S. Joint Special Operations Command between 2008 and 2011, and served as head of the United States Special Ops Command from August 2011 to 2014. He also served as Chancellor of the University of Texas System for over three years. As of Thursday morning, bookmaker William Hill had Senator Kelly as the firm favorite to be the Democrat's 2024 vice-presidential candidate with odds of 42.1 percent and 28.6 percent.

summary: Vice President Kamala Harris' list of potential running mates has narrowed to include one U.S. senator and several prominent Democratic governors. The Wall Street Journal reported that potential vice presidential candidates had been asked to provide vetting materials to the Harris campaign. This comes after President Joe Biden ended the presidential race and endorsed Harris. The Harris campaign has reportedly sought vetting materials from Senator Mark Kelly of Arizona, Governor Roy Cooper of North Carolina, Governor Josh Shapiro of Pennsylvania, Governor Gretchen Whitmer of Michigan, Governor J.B. Pritzker of Illinois, and Governor Tim Walz of Minnesota. However, Governor Andy Beshear of Kentucky has reportedly not been asked for vetting materials.

summary: Kamala Harris is currently vetting three potential candidates for the upcoming presidential election, including Mark Kelly, Josh SHAPIRO, and Tim Walz, the governor of Minnesota. These are seen as key decisions for Harris, as she knows her role as vice president is if something happens to the president. The campaign rollout of Kamala Harris has seen a surge in support for her, with her poll numbers up and her ability to play better in swing states than her predecessor, Joe Biden. She also brings a different coalition than Biden, with younger voters and voters of color who may have previously shunned from the Biden campaign. Despite this, there are concerns that this could change the course of action for Harris.

summary: Vice President Kamala Harris has defended President Joe Biden against pressure to drop out of the presidential race following a poor debate performance. If Biden withdraws, some Democrats believe Harris would be the logical choice to replace him on the top of the Democratic ticket. Harris, who is the first woman, Black person, and person of South Asian descent to serve as vice president, could face a difficult task of choosing a running mate who would give her the best chance of beating Donald Trump and becoming the nation's first woman president. Other potential running mates include California Gov. Gavin Newsom, Michigan's Whitmer, and Illinois's Shapiro. However, Newsom's lack of addressing issues such as homelessness could cause problems. JPMorgan Chase CEO Jamie Dim could help win over Republican voters who don't want a second term.

Roy Cooper, Kentucky Gov. Andy Beshear, and Michigan Gov. Gretchen Whitmer. This would be the first all-women ticket in history.

summary:
The Democratic candidate for the U.S. November presidential election, , has named a senator, Kamala Harris, as his running mate.

Ms Harris, 53, represents California in the Senate and is the first Black woman on a major party’s presidential ticket in the history of the U.S. 

She is a former prosecutor and state attorney general in California and is well-known for her aggressive questioning style in the Senate.

Mr Biden made the announcement in a tweet, on Tuesday, describing Ms Harris as a ‘fearless fighter.’

“I have the great honor to announce that I’ve picked — a fearless fighter for the little guy, and one of the country’s finest public servants — as my running mate.

“Back when Kamala was Attorney General, she worked closely with Beau. I watched as they took on the big banks, lifted up working people, and protected women and kids from abuse.

“I was proud then, and I’m proud now to have her as my partner in this campaign,” Mr Biden wrote. 

The Biden/Harris ticket will challenge President Donald Trump and Vice President Mike Pence in the November election.

Once rivals in the Democratic primaries, the pair are due to make their first joint appearance tonight in Mr Biden’s home state of Delaware.

summary:
"I have the great honor to announce that I've picked Kamala Harris — a fearless fighter for the little guy, and one of the country's finest public servants — as my running mate," Biden said on Twitter. 

Biden's search was expansive, including Massachusetts Sen. Elizabeth Warren, a leading progressive; Florida Rep. Val Demings, whose impeachment prosecution of Trump won plaudits; California Rep. Karen Bass, who leads the Congressional Black Caucus; former Obama national security adviser Susan Rice; and Atlanta Mayor Keisha Lance Bottoms, whose passionate response to unrest in her city garnered national attention. 

A woman has never served as president or vice president in the United States. "Kamala Harris' extreme positions, from raising taxes to abolishing private health insurance to comparing law enforcement officials to the KKK, show that the left-wing mob is controlling Biden's candidacy, just like they would control him as president.

summary:
The Democratic ticket in November will be Joe Biden and Sen. Kamala Harris. 

Harris joins Biden in the 2020 race at a moment of unprecedented national crisis. In one memorable moment last year, Harris tripped up Attorney General William Barr when she repeatedly pressed him on whether Trump or other White House officials pressured him to investigate certain people. The comments attributed to Dodd and first reported by Politico drew condemnation, especially from influential Democratic women who said Harris was being held to a standard that wouldn’t apply to a man running for president.

Some Biden confidants said Harris’ campaign attack did irritate the former vice president, who had a friendly relationship with her.

summary:
(Bloomberg) — Presumptive Democratic Party presidential nominee Joe Biden chose Senator Kamala Harris as his running mate Tuesday, betting that her ties to the African-American community and self-branding as a “progressive prosecutor” will help propel him to the White House. 

Since 2016, Harris has used her position as U.S. senator from California to push for a rise in the minimum wage, bail reform, and greater legal protections for immigrants and refugees. a resolution opposing Trump’s use of the term “Wuhan virus” to describe the pathogen that causes Covid-19, and condemning “all manifestations or expressions of racism, xenophobia, discrimination, anti-Asian sentiment, scapegoating, and ethnic or religious intolerance” in the United States. 

Biden committed to choosing a woman even before he’d won the nomination, making a surprise announcement during the final debate of the primary in mid-March.

summary: Kamala Harris is currently vetting three potential candidates for the upcoming presidential election, including Mark Kelly, Josh SHAPIRO, and Tim Walz, the governor of Minnesota. summary:
The Democratic candidate for the U.S. November presidential election, , has named a senator, Kamala Harris, as his running mate.

Ms Harris, 53, represents California in the Senate and is the first Black woman on a major party’s presidential ticket in the history of the U.S. 

She is a former prosecutor and state attorney general in California and is well-known for her aggressive questioning style in the Senate.

Mr Biden made the announcement in a tweet, on Tuesday, describing Ms Harris as a ‘fearless fighter.’

“I have the great honor to announce that I’ve picked — a fearless fighter for the little guy, and one of the country’s finest public servants — as my running mate.

“Back when Kamala was Attorney General, she worked closely with Beau. I watched as they took on the big banks, lifted up working people, and protected women and kids from abuse.

“I was proud then, and I’m proud now to have her as my partner in this campaign,” Mr Biden wrote. 

The Biden/Harris ticket will challenge President Donald Trump and Vice President Mike Pence in the November election.

summary:
"I have the great honor to announce that I've picked Kamala Harris — a fearless fighter for the little guy, and one of the country's finest public servants — as my running mate," Biden said on Twitter. 

Biden's search was expansive, including Massachusetts Sen. Elizabeth Warren, a leading progressive; Florida Rep. Val Demings, whose impeachment prosecution of Trump won plaudits; California Rep. Karen Bass, who leads the Congressional Black Caucus; former Obama national security adviser Susan Rice; and Atlanta Mayor Keisha Lance Bottoms, whose passionate response to unrest in her city garnered national attention. 

A woman has never served as president or vice president in the United States. "Kamala Harris' extreme positions, from raising taxes to abolishing private health insurance to comparing law enforcement officials to the KKK, show that the left-wing mob is controlling Biden's candidacy, just like they would control him as president.

summary:
The Democratic ticket in November will be Joe Biden and Sen. Kamala Harris. 

Harris joins Biden in the 2020 race at a moment of unprecedented national crisis. In one memorable moment last year, Harris tripped up Attorney General William Barr when she repeatedly pressed him on whether Trump or other White House officials pressured him to investigate certain people. The comments attributed to Dodd and first reported by Politico drew condemnation, especially from influential Democratic women who said Harris was being held to a standard that wouldn’t apply to a man running for president.

Some Biden confidants said Harris’ campaign attack did irritate the former vice president, who had a friendly relationship with her.

summary:
(Bloomberg) — Presumptive Democratic Party presidential nominee Joe Biden chose Senator Kamala Harris as his running mate Tuesday, betting that her ties to the African-American community and self-branding as a “progressive prosecutor” will help propel him to the White House. 

Since 2016, Harris has used her position as U.S. senator from California to push for a rise in the minimum wage, bail reform, and greater legal protections for immigrants and refugees. a resolution opposing Trump’s use of the term “Wuhan virus” to describe the pathogen that causes Covid-19, and condemning “all manifestations or expressions of racism, xenophobia, discrimination, anti-Asian sentiment, scapegoating, and ethnic or religious intolerance” in the United States. 

Biden committed to choosing a woman even before he’d won the nomination, making a surprise announcement during the final debate of the primary in mid-March.

summary: Kamala Harris' campaign team is reportedly vetting retired Admiral William McRaven, who oversaw the May 2011 Navy SEAL raid that killed Osama bin Laden, as a potential 2024 running mate for Vice President Kamala Harris. Other potential candidates include Arizona Senator Mark Kelly, Pennsylvania Governor Josh Shapiro, and Kentucky Governor Andy Beshear. McRaven was commander of the U.S. Joint Special Operations Command between 2008 and 2011, and served as head of the United States Special Ops Command from August 2011 to 2014. He also served as Chancellor of the University of Texas System for over three years. As of Thursday morning, bookmaker William Hill had Senator Kelly as the firm favorite to be the Democrat's 2024 vice-presidential candidate with odds of 42.1 percent and 28.6 percent.

McRaven was commander of the U.S. Joint Special Operations Command between 2008 and 2011, and served as head of the United States Special Ops Command from August 2011 to 2014. He also served as Chancellor of the University of Texas System for over three years. As of Thursday morning, bookmaker William Hill had Senator Kelly as the firm favorite to be the Democrat's 2024 vice-presidential candidate with odds of 42.1 percent and 28.6 percent.

summary:
Presumptive Democratic presidential nominee Joe Biden has chosen California Sen. Kamala Harris as his running mate, ending months of speculation and potentially placing a foreign-policy novice second in line to the American presidency. 

Presumptive Democratic presidential nominee Joe Biden has chosen California Sen. Kamala Harris as his running mate, ending months of speculation and potentially placing a foreign-policy novice second in line to the American presidency. The ad, which accused her of “attacking Joe Biden for racist policies,” also noted that Biden referred to himself as a “transition candidate.”

“He is handing over the reins to Kamala while they jointly embrace the radical left,” the ad stated. 

While Harris doesn’t have the experience of Biden on foreign policy, she is “no foreign-policy lightweight,” said Rebecca Bill Chavez, a former Pentagon official who advised Harris on foreign policy during her primary campaign.

summary: Vice President Kamala Harris' list of potential running mates has narrowed to include one U.S. senator and several prominent Democratic governors. The Wall Street Journal reported that potential vice presidential candidates had been asked to provide vetting materials to the Harris campaign. This comes after President Joe Biden ended the presidential race and endorsed Harris. The Harris campaign has reportedly sought vetting materials from Senator Mark Kelly of Arizona, Governor Roy Cooper of North Carolina, Governor Josh Shapiro of Pennsylvania, Governor Gretchen Whitmer of Michigan, Governor J.B. Pritzker of Illinois, and Governor Tim Walz of Minnesota. However, Governor Andy Beshear of Kentucky has reportedly not been asked for vetting materials.

summary: Kamala Harris is currently vetting three potential candidates for the upcoming presidential election, including Mark Kelly, Josh SHAPIRO, and Tim Walz, the governor of Minnesota. These are seen as key decisions for Harris, as she knows her role as vice president is if something happens to the president. The campaign rollout of Kamala Harris has seen a surge in support for her, with her poll numbers up and her ability to play better in swing states than her predecessor, Joe Biden. She also brings a different coalition than Biden, with younger voters and voters of color who may have previously shunned from the Biden campaign. Despite this, there are concerns that this could change the course of action for Harris.

summary:
The Democratic candidate for the U.S. November presidential election, , has named a senator, Kamala Harris, as his running mate.

Ms Harris, 53, represents California in the Senate and is the first Black woman on a major party’s presidential ticket in the history of the U.S. 

She is a former prosecutor and state attorney general in California and is well-known for her aggressive questioning style in the Senate.

Mr Biden made the announcement in a tweet, on Tuesday, describing Ms Harris as a ‘fearless fighter.’

“I have the great honor to announce that I’ve picked — a fearless fighter for the little guy, and one of the country’s finest public servants — as my running mate.

“Back when Kamala was Attorney General, she worked closely with Beau. I watched as they took on the big banks, lifted up working people, and protected women and kids from abuse.

“I was proud then, and I’m proud now to have her as my partner in this campaign,” Mr Biden wrote. 

The Biden/Harris ticket will challenge President Donald Trump and Vice President Mike Pence in the November election.
cleaned_summaries: democratic candidate u november presidential election named senator kamala harris running mate m harris 53 represents california senate first black woman major party’s presidential ticket history u former prosecutor state attorney general california wellknown aggressive questioning style senate mr biden made announcement tweet tuesday describing m harris ‘fearless fighter’ “i great honor announce i’ve picked — fearless fighter little guy one country’s finest public servant — running mate “back kamala attorney general worked closely beau watched took big bank lifted working people protected woman kid abuse “i proud i’m proud partner campaign” mr biden wrote bidenharris ticket challenge president donald trump vice president mike penny november election

summary:
Her career has already broken many barriers. 

Now the California senator Kamala Harris has broken one more, after Joe Biden picked her as his running mate in November’s presidential race. 

Once rivals in the Democratic primaries, the pair are due to make their first joint appearance tonight in Mr Biden’s home state of Delaware.

summary:
"I have the great honor to announce that I've picked Kamala Harris — a fearless fighter for the little guy, and one of the country's finest public servants — as my running mate," Biden said on Twitter. 

Biden's search was expansive, including Massachusetts Sen. Elizabeth Warren, a leading progressive; Florida Rep. Val Demings, whose impeachment prosecution of Trump won plaudits; California Rep. Karen Bass, who leads the Congressional Black Caucus; former Obama national security adviser Susan Rice; and Atlanta Mayor Keisha Lance Bottoms, whose passionate response to unrest in her city garnered national attention. 

A woman has never served as president or vice president in the United States. "Kamala Harris' extreme positions, from raising taxes to abolishing private health insurance to comparing law enforcement officials to the KKK, show that the left-wing mob is controlling Biden's candidacy, just like they would control him as president.

summary:
The Democratic ticket in November will be Joe Biden and Sen. Kamala Harris. 

Harris joins Biden in the 2020 race at a moment of unprecedented national crisis. In one memorable moment last year, Harris tripped up Attorney General William Barr when she repeatedly pressed him on whether Trump or other White House officials pressured him to investigate certain people. The comments attributed to Dodd and first reported by Politico drew condemnation, especially from influential Democratic women who said Harris was being held to a standard that wouldn’t apply to a man running for president.

Some Biden confidants said Harris’ campaign attack did irritate the former vice president, who had a friendly relationship with her.
cleaned_summaries: democratic ticket november joe biden sen kamala harris harris join biden 2020 race moment unprecedented national crisis one memorable moment last year harris tripped attorney general william barr repeatedly pressed whether trump white house official pressured investigate certain people comment attributed dodd first reported politico drew condemnation especially influential democratic woman said harris held standard wouldn’t apply man running president biden confidant said harris’ campaign attack irritate former vice president friendly relationship

summary:
(Bloomberg) — Presumptive Democratic Party presidential nominee Joe Biden chose Senator Kamala Harris as his running mate Tuesday, betting that her ties to the African-American community and self-branding as a “progressive prosecutor” will help propel him to the White House. 

Since 2016, Harris has used her position as U.S. senator from California to push for a rise in the minimum wage, bail reform, and greater legal protections for immigrants and refugees. a resolution opposing Trump’s use of the term “Wuhan virus” to describe the pathogen that causes Covid-19, and condemning “all manifestations or expressions of racism, xenophobia, discrimination, anti-Asian sentiment, scapegoating, and ethnic or religious intolerance” in the United States. 

Biden committed to choosing a woman even before he’d won the nomination, making a surprise announcement during the final debate of the primary in mid-March.
cleaned_summaries: bloomberg — presumptive democratic party presidential nominee joe biden chose senator kamala harris running mate tuesday betting tie africanamerican community selfbranding “progressive prosecutor” help propel white house since 2016 harris used position u senator california push rise minimum wage bail reform greater legal protection immigrant refugee resolution opposing trump’s use term “wuhan virus” describe pathogen cause covid19 condemning “all manifestation expression racism xenophobia discrimination antiasian sentiment scapegoating ethnic religious intolerance” united state biden committed choosing woman even he’d nomination making surprise announcement final debate primary midmarch

summary: If elected, Harris would be the first woman to serve as vice president, as well as the first Black woman to be second in command and the highest-elected Asian American in history.
cleaned_summaries: elected harris would first woman serve vice president well first black woman second command highestelected asian american history

summary: Kamala Harris' campaign team is reportedly vetting retired Admiral William McRaven, who oversaw the May 2011 Navy SEAL raid that killed Osama bin Laden, as a potential 2024 running mate for Vice President Kamala Harris. Other potential candidates include Arizona Senator Mark Kelly, Pennsylvania Governor Josh Shapiro, and Kentucky Governor Andy Beshear. McRaven was commander of the U.S. Joint Special Operations Command between 2008 and 2011, and served as head of the United States Special Ops Command from August 2011 to 2014. He also served as Chancellor of the University of Texas System for over three years. As of Thursday morning, bookmaker William Hill had Senator Kelly as the firm favorite to be the Democrat's 2024 vice-presidential candidate with odds of 42.1 percent and 28.6 percent.

summary:
Presumptive Democratic presidential nominee Joe Biden has chosen California Sen. Kamala Harris as his running mate, ending months of speculation and potentially placing a foreign-policy novice second in line to the American presidency. 

Presumptive Democratic presidential nominee Joe Biden has chosen California Sen. Kamala Harris as his running mate, ending months of speculation and potentially placing a foreign-policy novice second in line to the American presidency. The ad, which accused her of “attacking Joe Biden for racist policies,” also noted that Biden referred to himself as a “transition candidate.”

“He is handing over the reins to Kamala while they jointly embrace the radical left,” the ad stated. 

While Harris doesn’t have the experience of Biden on foreign policy, she is “no foreign-policy lightweight,” said Rebecca Bill Chavez, a former Pentagon official who advised Harris on foreign policy during her primary campaign.

summary: Vice President Kamala Harris' list of potential running mates has narrowed to include one U.S. senator and several prominent Democratic governors. The Wall Street Journal reported that potential vice presidential candidates had been asked to provide vetting materials to the Harris campaign. This comes after President Joe Biden ended the presidential race and endorsed Harris. The Harris campaign has reportedly sought vetting materials from Senator Mark Kelly of Arizona, Governor Roy Cooper of North Carolina, Governor Josh Shapiro of Pennsylvania, Governor Gretchen Whitmer of Michigan, Governor J.B. Pritzker of Illinois, and Governor Tim Walz of Minnesota. However, Governor Andy Beshear of Kentucky has reportedly not been asked for vetting materials.

summary: Kamala Harris is currently vetting three potential candidates for the upcoming presidential election, including Mark Kelly, Josh SHAPIRO, and Tim Walz, the governor of Minnesota. These are seen as key decisions for Harris, as she knows her role as vice president is if something happens to the president. The campaign rollout of Kamala Harris has seen a surge in support for her, with her poll numbers up and her ability to play better in swing states than her predecessor, Joe Biden. She also brings a different coalition than Biden, with younger voters and voters of color who may have previously shunned from the Biden campaign. Despite this, there are concerns that this could change the course of action for Harris.

summary:
The Democratic candidate for the U.S. November presidential election, , has named a senator, Kamala Harris, as his running mate.

Ms Harris, 53, represents California in the Senate and is the first Black woman on a major party’s presidential ticket in the history of the U.S. 

She is a former prosecutor and state attorney general in California and is well-known for her aggressive questioning style in the Senate.

Mr Biden made the announcement in a tweet, on Tuesday, describing Ms Harris as a ‘fearless fighter.’

“I have the great honor to announce that I’ve picked — a fearless fighter for the little guy, and one of the country’s finest public servants — as my running mate.

“Back when Kamala was Attorney General, she worked closely with Beau. I watched as they took on the big banks, lifted up working people, and protected women and kids from abuse.

“I was proud then, and I’m proud now to have her as my partner in this campaign,” Mr Biden wrote. 

The Biden/Harris ticket will challenge President Donald Trump and Vice President Mike Pence in the November election.
cleaned_summaries: democratic candidate u november presidential election named senator kamala harris running mate m harris 53 represents california senate first black woman major party’s presidential ticket history u former prosecutor state attorney general california wellknown aggressive questioning style senate mr biden made announcement tweet tuesday describing m harris ‘fearless fighter’ “i great honor announce i’ve picked — fearless fighter little guy one country’s finest public servant — running mate “back kamala attorney general worked closely beau watched took big bank lifted working people protected woman kid abuse “i proud i’m proud partner campaign” mr biden wrote bidenharris ticket challenge president donald trump vice president mike penny november election

summary:
Her career has already broken many barriers. 

Now the California senator Kamala Harris has broken one more, after Joe Biden picked her as his running mate in November’s presidential race. 

Once rivals in the Democratic primaries, the pair are due to make their first joint appearance tonight in Mr Biden’s home state of Delaware.

summary:
"I have the great honor to announce that I've picked Kamala Harris — a fearless fighter for the little guy, and one of the country's finest public servants — as my running mate," Biden said on Twitter. 

Biden's search was expansive, including Massachusetts Sen. Elizabeth Warren, a leading progressive; Florida Rep. Val Demings, whose impeachment prosecution of Trump won plaudits; California Rep. Karen Bass, who leads the Congressional Black Caucus; former Obama national security adviser Susan Rice; and Atlanta Mayor Keisha Lance Bottoms, whose passionate response to unrest in her city garnered national attention. 

A woman has never served as president or vice president in the United States. "Kamala Harris' extreme positions, from raising taxes to abolishing private health insurance to comparing law enforcement officials to the KKK, show that the left-wing mob is controlling Biden's candidacy, just like they would control him as president.

summary:
The Democratic ticket in November will be Joe Biden and Sen. Kamala Harris. 

Harris joins Biden in the 2020 race at a moment of unprecedented national crisis. In one memorable moment last year, Harris tripped up Attorney General William Barr when she repeatedly pressed him on whether Trump or other White House officials pressured him to investigate certain people. The comments attributed to Dodd and first reported by Politico drew condemnation, especially from influential Democratic women who said Harris was being held to a standard that wouldn’t apply to a man running for president.

Some Biden confidants said Harris’ campaign attack did irritate the former vice president, who had a friendly relationship with her.

summary:
(Bloomberg) — Presumptive Democratic Party presidential nominee Joe Biden chose Senator Kamala Harris as his running mate Tuesday, betting that her ties to the African-American community and self-branding as a “progressive prosecutor” will help propel him to the White House. 

Since 2016, Harris has used her position as U.S. senator from California to push for a rise in the minimum wage, bail reform, and greater legal protections for immigrants and refugees. a resolution opposing Trump’s use of the term “Wuhan virus” to describe the pathogen that causes Covid-19, and condemning “all manifestations or expressions of racism, xenophobia, discrimination, anti-Asian sentiment, scapegoating, and ethnic or religious intolerance” in the United States. 

Biden committed to choosing a woman even before he’d won the nomination, making a surprise announcement during the final debate of the primary in mid-March.

Biden committed to choosing a woman even before he’d won the nomination, making a surprise announcement during the final debate of the primary in mid-March.

summary: Kamala Harris' campaign team is reportedly vetting retired Admiral William McRaven, who oversaw the May 2011 Navy SEAL raid that killed Osama bin Laden, as a potential 2024 running mate for Vice President Kamala Harris. Other potential candidates include Arizona Senator Mark Kelly, Pennsylvania Governor Josh Shapiro, and Kentucky Governor Andy Beshear. McRaven was commander of the U.S. Joint Special Operations Command between 2008 and 2011, and served as head of the United States Special Ops Command from August 2011 to 2014. He also served as Chancellor of the University of Texas System for over three years. As of Thursday morning, bookmaker William Hill had Senator Kelly as the firm favorite to be the Democrat's 2024 vice-presidential candidate with odds of 42.1 percent and 28.6 percent.

Presumptive Democratic presidential nominee Joe Biden has chosen California Sen. summary: Vice President Kamala Harris' list of potential running mates has narrowed to include one U.S. senator and several prominent Democratic governors. The Wall Street Journal reported that potential vice presidential candidates had been asked to provide vetting materials to the Harris campaign. This comes after President Joe Biden ended the presidential race and endorsed Harris. The Harris campaign has reportedly sought vetting materials from Senator Mark Kelly of Arizona, Governor Roy Cooper of North Carolina, Governor Josh Shapiro of Pennsylvania, Governor Gretchen Whitmer of Michigan, Governor J.B. Pritzker of Illinois, and Governor Tim Walz of Minnesota. However, Governor Andy Beshear of Kentucky has reportedly not been asked for vetting materials.

summary: Kamala Harris is currently vetting three potential candidates for the upcoming presidential election, including Mark Kelly, Josh SHAPIRO, and Tim Walz, the governor of Minnesota. These are seen as key decisions for Harris, as she knows her role as vice president is if something happens to the president. The campaign rollout of Kamala Harris has seen a surge in support for her, with her poll numbers up and her ability to play better in swing states than her predecessor, Joe Biden. She also brings a different coalition than Biden, with younger voters and voters of color who may have previously shunned from the Biden campaign. Despite this, there are concerns that this could change the course of action for Harris.

summary:
The Democratic candidate for the U.S. November presidential election, , has named a senator, Kamala Harris, as his running mate.

Ms Harris, 53, represents California in the Senate and is the first Black woman on a major party’s presidential ticket in the history of the U.S. 

She is a former prosecutor and state attorney general in California and is well-known for her aggressive questioning style in the Senate.

Mr Biden made the announcement in a tweet, on Tuesday, describing Ms Harris as a ‘fearless fighter.’

“I have the great honor to announce that I’ve picked — a fearless fighter for the little guy, and one of the country’s finest public servants — as my running mate.

“Back when Kamala was Attorney General, she worked closely with Beau. I watched as they took on the big banks, lifted up working people, and protected women and kids from abuse.

“I was proud then, and I’m proud now to have her as my partner in this campaign,” Mr Biden wrote. 

The Biden/Harris ticket will challenge President Donald Trump and Vice President Mike Pence in the November election.

summary:
Her career has already broken many barriers. 

Now the California senator Kamala Harris has broken one more, after Joe Biden picked her as his running mate in November’s presidential race. 

Once rivals in the Democratic primaries, the pair are due to make their first joint appearance tonight in Mr Biden’s home state of Delaware.

summary:
"I have the great honor to announce that I've picked Kamala Harris — a fearless fighter for the little guy, and one of the country's finest public servants — as my running mate," Biden said on Twitter. 

Biden's search was expansive, including Massachusetts Sen. Elizabeth Warren, a leading progressive; Florida Rep. Val Demings, whose impeachment prosecution of Trump won plaudits; California Rep. Karen Bass, who leads the Congressional Black Caucus; former Obama national security adviser Susan Rice; and Atlanta Mayor Keisha Lance Bottoms, whose passionate response to unrest in her city garnered national attention. 

A woman has never served as president or vice president in the United States. "Kamala Harris' extreme positions, from raising taxes to abolishing private health insurance to comparing law enforcement officials to the KKK, show that the left-wing mob is controlling Biden's candidacy, just like they would control him as president.

summary:
The Democratic ticket in November will be Joe Biden and Sen. Kamala Harris. 

Harris joins Biden in the 2020 race at a moment of unprecedented national crisis. In one memorable moment last year, Harris tripped up Attorney General William Barr when she repeatedly pressed him on whether Trump or other White House officials pressured him to investigate certain people. The comments attributed to Dodd and first reported by Politico drew condemnation, especially from influential Democratic women who said Harris was being held to a standard that wouldn’t apply to a man running for president.

Some Biden confidants said Harris’ campaign attack did irritate the former vice president, who had a friendly relationship with her.

summary: Kamala Harris is currently vetting three potential candidates for the upcoming presidential election, including Mark Kelly, Josh SHAPIRO, and Tim Walz, the governor of Minnesota. These are seen as key decisions for Harris, as she knows her role as vice president is if something happens to the president. The campaign rollout of Kamala Harris has seen a surge in support for her, with her poll numbers up and her ability to play better in swing states than her predecessor, Joe Biden. summary:
The Democratic candidate for the U.S. November presidential election, , has named a senator, Kamala Harris, as his running mate.

Ms Harris, 53, represents California in the Senate and is the first Black woman on a major party’s presidential ticket in the history of the U.S. 

She is a former prosecutor and state attorney general in California and is well-known for her aggressive questioning style in the Senate.

Mr Biden made the announcement in a tweet, on Tuesday, describing Ms Harris as a ‘fearless fighter.’

“I have the great honor to announce that I’ve picked — a fearless fighter for the little guy, and one of the country’s finest public servants — as my running mate.

“Back when Kamala was Attorney General, she worked closely with Beau. I watched as they took on the big banks, lifted up working people, and protected women and kids from abuse.

“I was proud then, and I’m proud now to have her as my partner in this campaign,” Mr Biden wrote. 

The Biden/Harris ticket will challenge President Donald Trump and Vice President Mike Pence in the November election.

Her career has already broken many barriers. 

Now the California senator Kamala Harris has broken one more, after Joe Biden picked her as his running mate in November’s presidential race. 

Once rivals in the Democratic primaries, the pair are due to make their first joint appearance tonight in Mr Biden’s home state of Delaware.

summary:
"I have the great honor to announce that I've picked Kamala Harris — a fearless fighter for the little guy, and one of the country's finest public servants — as my running mate," Biden said on Twitter. 

Biden's search was expansive, including Massachusetts Sen. Elizabeth Warren, a leading progressive; Florida Rep. Val Demings, whose impeachment prosecution of Trump won plaudits; California Rep. Karen Bass, who leads the Congressional Black Caucus; former Obama national security adviser Susan Rice; and Atlanta Mayor Keisha Lance Bottoms, whose passionate response to unrest in her city garnered national attention. 

A woman has never served as president or vice president in the United States. "Kamala Harris' extreme positions, from raising taxes to abolishing private health insurance to comparing law enforcement officials to the KKK, show that the left-wing mob is controlling Biden's candidacy, just like they would control him as president.

summary:
The Democratic ticket in November will be Joe Biden and Sen. Kamala Harris. 

Harris joins Biden in the 2020 race at a moment of unprecedented national crisis. In one memorable moment last year, Harris tripped up Attorney General William Barr when she repeatedly pressed him on whether Trump or other White House officials pressured him to investigate certain people. The comments attributed to Dodd and first reported by Politico drew condemnation, especially from influential Democratic women who said Harris was being held to a standard that wouldn’t apply to a man running for president.

Some Biden confidants said Harris’ campaign attack did irritate the former vice president, who had a friendly relationship with her.

In one memorable moment last year, Harris tripped up Attorney General William Barr when she repeatedly pressed him on whether Trump or other White House officials pressured him to investigate certain people. The comments attributed to Dodd and first reported by Politico drew condemnation, especially from influential Democratic women who said Harris was being held to a standard that wouldn’t apply to a man running for president.

Some Biden confidants said Harris’ campaign attack did irritate the former vice president, who had a friendly relationship with her.

(Bloomberg) — Presumptive Democratic Party presidential nominee Joe Biden chose Senator Kamala Harris as his running mate Tuesday, betting that her ties to the African-American community and self-branding as a “progressive prosecutor” will help propel him to the White House. 

Since 2016, Harris has used her position as U.S. senator from California to push for a rise in the minimum wage, bail reform, and greater legal protections for immigrants and refugees. a resolution opposing Trump’s use of the term “Wuhan virus” to describe the pathogen that causes Covid-19, and condemning “all manifestations or expressions of racism, xenophobia, discrimination, anti-Asian sentiment, scapegoating, and ethnic or religious intolerance” in the United States.

summary: Kamala Harris' campaign team is reportedly vetting retired Admiral William McRaven, who oversaw the May 2011 Navy SEAL raid that killed Osama bin Laden, as a potential 2024 running mate for Vice President Kamala Harris. Other potential candidates include Arizona Senator Mark Kelly, Pennsylvania Governor Josh Shapiro, and Kentucky Governor Andy Beshear. McRaven was commander of the U.S. Joint Special Operations Command between 2008 and 2011, and served as head of the United States Special Ops Command from August 2011 to 2014. He also served as Chancellor of the University of Texas System for over three years. As of Thursday morning, bookmaker William Hill had Senator Kelly as the firm favorite to be the Democrat's 2024 vice-presidential candidate with odds of 42.1 percent and 28.6 percent.

summary: Kamala Harris is currently vetting three potential candidates for the upcoming presidential election, including Mark Kelly, Josh SHAPIRO, and Tim Walz, the governor of Minnesota. These are seen as key decisions for Harris, as she knows her role as vice president is if something happens to the president. The campaign rollout of Kamala Harris has seen a surge in support for her, with her poll numbers up and her ability to play better in swing states than her predecessor, Joe Biden. She also brings a different coalition than Biden, with younger voters and voters of color who may have previously shunned from the Biden campaign. Despite this, there are concerns that this could change the course of action for Harris.

summary:
The Democratic candidate for the U.S. November presidential election, , has named a senator, Kamala Harris, as his running mate.

Ms Harris, 53, represents California in the Senate and is the first Black woman on a major party’s presidential ticket in the history of the U.S. 

She is a former prosecutor and state attorney general in California and is well-known for her aggressive questioning style in the Senate.

Mr Biden made the announcement in a tweet, on Tuesday, describing Ms Harris as a ‘fearless fighter.’

“I have the great honor to announce that I’ve picked — a fearless fighter for the little guy, and one of the country’s finest public servants — as my running mate.

“Back when Kamala was Attorney General, she worked closely with Beau. I watched as they took on the big banks, lifted up working people, and protected women and kids from abuse.

“I was proud then, and I’m proud now to have her as my partner in this campaign,” Mr Biden wrote. 

The Biden/Harris ticket will challenge President Donald Trump and Vice President Mike Pence in the November election.

Once rivals in the Democratic primaries, the pair are due to make their first joint appearance tonight in Mr Biden’s home state of Delaware.

summary:
"I have the great honor to announce that I've picked Kamala Harris — a fearless fighter for the little guy, and one of the country's finest public servants — as my running mate," Biden said on Twitter. 

Biden's search was expansive, including Massachusetts Sen. Elizabeth Warren, a leading progressive; Florida Rep. Val Demings, whose impeachment prosecution of Trump won plaudits; California Rep. Karen Bass, who leads the Congressional Black Caucus; former Obama national security adviser Susan Rice; and Atlanta Mayor Keisha Lance Bottoms, whose passionate response to unrest in her city garnered national attention. 

A woman has never served as president or vice president in the United States. "Kamala Harris' extreme positions, from raising taxes to abolishing private health insurance to comparing law enforcement officials to the KKK, show that the left-wing mob is controlling Biden's candidacy, just like they would control him as president.

summary:
The Democratic ticket in November will be Joe Biden and Sen. Kamala Harris. 

Harris joins Biden in the 2020 race at a moment of unprecedented national crisis. In one memorable moment last year, Harris tripped up Attorney General William Barr when she repeatedly pressed him on whether Trump or other White House officials pressured him to investigate certain people. The comments attributed to Dodd and first reported by Politico drew condemnation, especially from influential Democratic women who said Harris was being held to a standard that wouldn’t apply to a man running for president.

Some Biden confidants said Harris’ campaign attack did irritate the former vice president, who had a friendly relationship with her.

summary:
(Bloomberg) — Presumptive Democratic Party presidential nominee Joe Biden chose Senator Kamala Harris as his running mate Tuesday, betting that her ties to the African-American community and self-branding as a “progressive prosecutor” will help propel him to the White House. 

Since 2016, Harris has used her position as U.S. senator from California to push for a rise in the minimum wage, bail reform, and greater legal protections for immigrants and refugees. a resolution opposing Trump’s use of the term “Wuhan virus” to describe the pathogen that causes Covid-19, and condemning “all manifestations or expressions of racism, xenophobia, discrimination, anti-Asian sentiment, scapegoating, and ethnic or religious intolerance” in the United States. 

Biden committed to choosing a woman even before he’d won the nomination, making a surprise announcement during the final debate of the primary in mid-March.

summary: Kamala Harris' campaign team is reportedly vetting retired Admiral William McRaven, who oversaw the May 2011 Navy SEAL raid that killed Osama bin Laden, as a potential 2024 running mate for Vice President Kamala Harris. Other potential candidates include Arizona Senator Mark Kelly, Pennsylvania Governor Josh Shapiro, and Kentucky Governor Andy Beshear. McRaven was commander of the U.S. Joint Special Operations Command between 2008 and 2011, and served as head of the United States Special Ops Command from August 2011 to 2014. He also served as Chancellor of the University of Texas System for over three years. As of Thursday morning, bookmaker William Hill had Senator Kelly as the firm favorite to be the Democrat's 2024 vice-presidential candidate with odds of 42.1 percent and 28.6 percent.

summary: Vice President Kamala Harris' list of potential running mates has narrowed to include one U.S. senator and several prominent Democratic governors. The Wall Street Journal reported that potential vice presidential candidates had been asked to provide vetting materials to the Harris campaign. This comes after President Joe Biden ended the presidential race and endorsed Harris. The Harris campaign has reportedly sought vetting materials from Senator Mark Kelly of Arizona, Governor Roy Cooper of North Carolina, Governor Josh Shapiro of Pennsylvania, Governor Gretchen Whitmer of Michigan, Governor J.B. Pritzker of Illinois, and Governor Tim Walz of Minnesota. However, Governor Andy Beshear of Kentucky has reportedly not been asked for vetting materials.

summary: Kamala Harris is currently vetting three potential candidates for the upcoming presidential election, including Mark Kelly, Josh SHAPIRO, and Tim Walz, the governor of Minnesota. These are seen as key decisions for Harris, as she knows her role as vice president is if something happens to the president. The campaign rollout of Kamala Harris has seen a surge in support for her, with her poll numbers up and her ability to play better in swing states than her predecessor, Joe Biden. She also brings a different coalition than Biden, with younger voters and voters of color who may have previously shunned from the Biden campaign. Despite this, there are concerns that this could change the course of action for Harris.

summary:
The Democratic candidate for the U.S. November presidential election, , has named a senator, Kamala Harris, as his running mate.

Ms Harris, 53, represents California in the Senate and is the first Black woman on a major party’s presidential ticket in the history of the U.S. 

She is a former prosecutor and state attorney general in California and is well-known for her aggressive questioning style in the Senate.

Mr Biden made the announcement in a tweet, on Tuesday, describing Ms Harris as a ‘fearless fighter.’

“I have the great honor to announce that I’ve picked — a fearless fighter for the little guy, and one of the country’s finest public servants — as my running mate.

“Back when Kamala was Attorney General, she worked closely with Beau. I watched as they took on the big banks, lifted up working people, and protected women and kids from abuse.

“I was proud then, and I’m proud now to have her as my partner in this campaign,” Mr Biden wrote. 

The Biden/Harris ticket will challenge President Donald Trump and Vice President Mike Pence in the November election.

Once rivals in the Democratic primaries, the pair are due to make their first joint appearance tonight in Mr Biden’s home state of Delaware.

Karen Bass, who leads the Congressional Black Caucus; former Obama national security adviser Susan Rice; and Atlanta Mayor Keisha Lance Bottoms, whose passionate response to unrest in her city garnered national attention. 

A woman has never served as president or vice president in the United States. "Kamala Harris' extreme positions, from raising taxes to abolishing private health insurance to comparing law enforcement officials to the KKK, show that the left-wing mob is controlling Biden's candidacy, just like they would control him as president.

summary:
The Democratic ticket in November will be Joe Biden and Sen. Kamala Harris. 

Harris joins Biden in the 2020 race at a moment of unprecedented national crisis. In one memorable moment last year, Harris tripped up Attorney General William Barr when she repeatedly pressed him on whether Trump or other White House officials pressured him to investigate certain people. The comments attributed to Dodd and first reported by Politico drew condemnation, especially from influential Democratic women who said Harris was being held to a standard that wouldn’t apply to a man running for president.

Some Biden confidants said Harris’ campaign attack did irritate the former vice president, who had a friendly relationship with her.

summary:
(Bloomberg) — Presumptive Democratic Party presidential nominee Joe Biden chose Senator Kamala Harris as his running mate Tuesday, betting that her ties to the African-American community and self-branding as a “progressive prosecutor” will help propel him to the White House. 

Since 2016, Harris has used her position as U.S. senator from California to push for a rise in the minimum wage, bail reform, and greater legal protections for immigrants and refugees. a resolution opposing Trump’s use of the term “Wuhan virus” to describe the pathogen that causes Covid-19, and condemning “all manifestations or expressions of racism, xenophobia, discrimination, anti-Asian sentiment, scapegoating, and ethnic or religious intolerance” in the United States. 

Biden committed to choosing a woman even before he’d won the nomination, making a surprise announcement during the final debate of the primary in mid-March.

summary: Kamala Harris' campaign team is reportedly vetting retired Admiral William McRaven, who oversaw the May 2011 Navy SEAL raid that killed Osama bin Laden, as a potential 2024 running mate for Vice President Kamala Harris. Other potential candidates include Arizona Senator Mark Kelly, Pennsylvania Governor Josh Shapiro, and Kentucky Governor Andy Beshear. McRaven was commander of the U.S. Joint Special Operations Command between 2008 and 2011, and served as head of the United States Special Ops Command from August 2011 to 2014. He also served as Chancellor of the University of Texas System for over three years. As of Thursday morning, bookmaker William Hill had Senator Kelly as the firm favorite to be the Democrat's 2024 vice-presidential candidate with odds of 42.1 percent and 28.6 percent.

summary: Vice President Kamala Harris' list of potential running mates has narrowed to include one U.S. senator and several prominent Democratic governors. The Wall Street Journal reported that potential vice presidential candidates had been asked to provide vetting materials to the Harris campaign. This comes after President Joe Biden ended the presidential race and endorsed Harris. The Harris campaign has reportedly sought vetting materials from Senator Mark Kelly of Arizona, Governor Roy Cooper of North Carolina, Governor Josh Shapiro of Pennsylvania, Governor Gretchen Whitmer of Michigan, Governor J.B. Pritzker of Illinois, and Governor Tim Walz of Minnesota. However, Governor Andy Beshear of Kentucky has reportedly not been asked for vetting materials.

summary: Kamala Harris is currently vetting three potential candidates for the upcoming presidential election, including Mark Kelly, Josh SHAPIRO, and Tim Walz, the governor of Minnesota. These are seen as key decisions for Harris, as she knows her role as vice president is if something happens to the president. The campaign rollout of Kamala Harris has seen a surge in support for her, with her poll numbers up and her ability to play better in swing states than her predecessor, Joe Biden. She also brings a different coalition than Biden, with younger voters and voters of color who may have previously shunned from the Biden campaign. Despite this, there are concerns that this could change the course of action for Harris.

summary:
The Democratic candidate for the U.S. November presidential election, , has named a senator, Kamala Harris, as his running mate.

Ms Harris, 53, represents California in the Senate and is the first Black woman on a major party’s presidential ticket in the history of the U.S. 

She is a former prosecutor and state attorney general in California and is well-known for her aggressive questioning style in the Senate.

Mr Biden made the announcement in a tweet, on Tuesday, describing Ms Harris as a ‘fearless fighter.’

“I have the great honor to announce that I’ve picked — a fearless fighter for the little guy, and one of the country’s finest public servants — as my running mate.

“Back when Kamala was Attorney General, she worked closely with Beau. I watched as they took on the big banks, lifted up working people, and protected women and kids from abuse.

“I was proud then, and I’m proud now to have her as my partner in this campaign,” Mr Biden wrote. 

The Biden/Harris ticket will challenge President Donald Trump and Vice President Mike Pence in the November election.

Once rivals in the Democratic primaries, the pair are due to make their first joint appearance tonight in Mr Biden’s home state of Delaware.

summary:
The Democratic ticket in November will be Joe Biden and Sen. Kamala Harris. 

Harris joins Biden in the 2020 race at a moment of unprecedented national crisis. In one memorable moment last year, Harris tripped up Attorney General William Barr when she repeatedly pressed him on whether Trump or other White House officials pressured him to investigate certain people. The comments attributed to Dodd and first reported by Politico drew condemnation, especially from influential Democratic women who said Harris was being held to a standard that wouldn’t apply to a man running for president.

Some Biden confidants said Harris’ campaign attack did irritate the former vice president, who had a friendly relationship with her.

summary:
(Bloomberg) — Presumptive Democratic Party presidential nominee Joe Biden chose Senator Kamala Harris as his running mate Tuesday, betting that her ties to the African-American community and self-branding as a “progressive prosecutor” will help propel him to the White House. 

Since 2016, Harris has used her position as U.S. senator from California to push for a rise in the minimum wage, bail reform, and greater legal protections for immigrants and refugees. a resolution opposing Trump’s use of the term “Wuhan virus” to describe the pathogen that causes Covid-19, and condemning “all manifestations or expressions of racism, xenophobia, discrimination, anti-Asian sentiment, scapegoating, and ethnic or religious intolerance” in the United States.

summary: Kamala Harris' campaign team is reportedly vetting retired Admiral William McRaven, who oversaw the May 2011 Navy SEAL raid that killed Osama bin Laden, as a potential 2024 running mate for Vice President Kamala Harris. Other potential candidates include Arizona Senator Mark Kelly, Pennsylvania Governor Josh Shapiro, and Kentucky Governor Andy Beshear. McRaven was commander of the U.S. Joint Special Operations Command between 2008 and 2011, and served as head of the United States Special Ops Command from August 2011 to 2014. He also served as Chancellor of the University of Texas System for over three years. As of Thursday morning, bookmaker William Hill had Senator Kelly as the firm favorite to be the Democrat's 2024 vice-presidential candidate with odds of 42.1 percent and 28.6 percent.

summary: Vice President Kamala Harris' list of potential running mates has narrowed to include one U.S. senator and several prominent Democratic governors. The Wall Street Journal reported that potential vice presidential candidates had been asked to provide vetting materials to the Harris campaign. This comes after President Joe Biden ended the presidential race and endorsed Harris. The Harris campaign has reportedly sought vetting materials from Senator Mark Kelly of Arizona, Governor Roy Cooper of North Carolina, Governor Josh Shapiro of Pennsylvania, Governor Gretchen Whitmer of Michigan, Governor J.B. Pritzker of Illinois, and Governor Tim Walz of Minnesota. However, Governor Andy Beshear of Kentucky has reportedly not been asked for vetting materials.

summary: Kamala Harris is currently vetting three potential candidates for the upcoming presidential election, including Mark Kelly, Josh SHAPIRO, and Tim Walz, the governor of Minnesota. These are seen as key decisions for Harris, as she knows her role as vice president is if something happens to the president. The campaign rollout of Kamala Harris has seen a surge in support for her, with her poll numbers up and her ability to play better in swing states than her predecessor, Joe Biden. She also brings a different coalition than Biden, with younger voters and voters of color who may have previously shunned from the Biden campaign. Despite this, there are concerns that this could change the course of action for Harris.
